DataElement.preferredName: Person Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Active Study Participation Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person is participating or planning to participate in an approved and ongoing clinical trial sponsored by Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group, a cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Active Study Participation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person participating in an approved and ongoing clinical trial sponsored by Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group, a cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs.

Property.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Active Study Participation
Property.preferredDefinition: The Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) was established in 1955. This is a cooperative group (Philadelphia, PA) funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.:A clinical study status designating the study open to accrual.:Taking part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.
A clinical study status designating the study open to accrual.
The act of taking part in an activity.
